intro: Maoutia rugosa, commonly known as the rough maoutia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed enclosed in a fleshy pulp. Maoutia rugosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
